title: Some comments about WRITE statement
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/165

I have tried to use WRITE statement instead of PRINT, and I have got some errors with it:

1. Type mismatching, when CHARACTER string is trying to be outputted:
```
write (*,*) "TEXT"
```
The error is:
```
Type mismatch: LHS=_run3 (Integer()), RHS=<lfortran.ast.ast.Str object at 0x7fcb309ab090> (None)
```
At the same time, `print *, "TEXT"` is working.

2. Internal bug, it WRITE statement is in any construction. For example, in DO-ENDDO statement:
```
integer i
do i = 1, 2
  write (*,*) i
end do
```
Long backtrace with the output in the end:
```
This is an internal error in fortran_kernel, please send a bug report.
```
At the same time, `print *,i` is working.
3. WRITE statement unit is not working. I have tried to use different units for writing, and I failed with it: all outputs were in standard output [tested in Jupiter Notebook]. For example:
```
WRITE (10, *) 1
```
4. In Jupiter notebook, only the latest WRITE statement will be used for output. It means that the following code:
```
WRITE(*,*) 1
WRITE(*,*) 3

```
prints just `3`.
5. In continuing `4.`... WRITE statement is overwriting by PRINT statement:
```
WRITE (*, *) 1
WRITE (*, *) 3
print *, 6
print *, 8
```
The output will be only 
```
6
8
```
